BLIST.TITLE: Output
BLIST.ITEM: Give less output. Option is additive, can be used up to 3 times: -q, --quiet.
Give more output. Option is additive, can be used up to 3 times: -v, --verbose.
Install packages python -m pip install <package1> <package2> <package3> or pip install <package1> <package2> <package3>
Install a specific version pip install requests==2.6.0
Install the packages defined in a requirements.txt file pip install -r requirements.txt
Upgrade a package pip install -U <package> pip install --upgrade <package>

Install a package from the default branch of a Git repository pip install git+https://gitlab.com/opentestfactory/agent The version (commit ID) is available in /c/Users/lmazure/AppData/Local/Programs/Python/Python39/lib/site-packages/opentf_agent-*.dist-info/direct_url.json.
See https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/specifications/direct-url/https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/specifications/direct-url/
enHTML.
Install a package from a given branch of a Git repository pip install git+https://gitlab.com/opentestfactory/agent@rel-1.3.1
Uninstall some packages pip uninstall <package1> <package2> <package3> pip uninstall -r requirements.txt
List the installed packages pip list
List the installed packages in the format expected by pip install pip freeze > requirements.txt
List the out-of-date installed packages pip list -o pip list --outdated
Do not list globally-installed packages pip list -l pip list --local
Show information about some installed packages. pip show <package1> <package2> <package3>

When installing from https://test.pypi.org/ (e.g. pip install -i https://test.pypi.org/simple/ squash-data-simulator==0.1.6.32279), the dependencies must be already installed, otherwise the installation will fail (I believe because pip will try to install them from https://test.pypi.org/ and they are not present there).
List the available versions of a package. pip index versions <package3>
